comments:
I think this may be related to bug#  16848. However, in this case, we got to 
the rendering point, rather than the initialization point. The thread could 
return a "<disconnected>" or "<unknown>" label when this happens.

JDIModelPresentation.getText(element) catches thrown DebugExceptions, writes 
the stack trace to the log, and returns "<not responding>".

Since we handle the exception and return a valid label, do we need to write 
the exception to the log? Does this help us in any way?

The log helps becuase it lets us know what went wrong in the event of an 
unexpected runtime exception. However, in this case, nothing went wrong - we 
are just trying to render after the thread has died (The thread was created, 
fired a create event, and then while the debug UI is inserting the thread into 
the tree, the VM exits).

I think this is another one of the special "catch" cases - i.e. if the 
underlying exception is a VMDisconnect, do not log the error.

JDIModelPresentation.getText() and JDIModelPresentation.getImage() no longer 
log VMDisconnectedExceptions.

Please verify.
